result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew T. Krumpos

records.addlTxt: 1:31 PM Defendant Matthew T. Krumpos in court, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch in court for Matthew T. Krumpos.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  Atty Dolch states they are requesting a reset so she can delve into possible issues w/the DE by hiring a doctor although she in concerned w/the DE's competency.  Court questions DE on his understanding of what's happening today.  DE is in agreement.  Court notes bond will continue.  Court will allow the matter not to proceed today and notes there is a TSC set already for 12/7/22 at 4:15 and they can address status on all matters at that time.  All matters to track.
Plea hearing on October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference on December 7, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

Atty Dolch acknowledges rec. information, waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Dolch stands mute.  Court enters not guilty plea(s) - set for TSC in about 60 days.  TR matters to track.  Bond continued.

9:15 AM Defendant Matthew T. Krumpos in court, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch in court for Matthew T. Krumpos.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  22CF300 is set or prelim today - all other cases are tracking.  Atty Dolch states DE will waive his right to prelim today in 22CF300.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:12 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew T. Krumpos appeared by video, in custody from LEC w/atty. Dolch. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE qualifies for PD representation.  State requests $50,000 Cash.  Atty. Dolch has no objection to conditions and requests $500 Cash.  DE is on supervision bu Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/M.B.K. or R.C.H. or their residences, No contact w/residence of  S3815A Larue Rd in Lavalle WI, Absolute Sobriety; No possession of any dangerous weapons. No presence upon bars/taverns/liquor stores where primary sale is alcohol.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on July 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
